segments.text: I’m watching the water spill over the sink, and it’s making me anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t understand how she can be so oblivious to the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting more and more slippery, and someone is going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy with their cookies to notice the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to do something, but I’m just an observer here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice or if she’ll just keep drying dishes forever.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is a disaster waiting to happen, and I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m holding my breath, waiting for the moment everything goes wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
